page.title: 11Longships Lighthouse
page.content: On a clear night as many as seven lights from lighthouses and light ships can be seen from the Land's End. Perhaps the most famous of these is the Longships, seen by hundreds of thousands of visitors every year. The first Longships Lighthouse was actually built at Sennen in 1794.Each stone was carefully marked and then moved out to Carn Bras,the largest of the Longships reef. In 1873 the original tower was replac ed by Sir James Douglass with a new lighthouse increasing its strength to 72,000 candlepower and its clear weath er range to 17 miles. In 1966 the Longships became one of the first British lighthouses to have urgent supplies flown out by helicop ter.A helipad was added in 1974 to make this task easier and safer.
